Posts.Content: My mother was undergoing treatment for cancer for past 3.5 years (diagnosed in Oct'04). Now, her doctor has advised that she is progressing and will require support of general physician. Currently, her oncologist does not recommend any further medication, at this juncture. Request advice for any further course of action on any other alternative medication / suggested care Case History:  She has been a diabetic patient for past 8 years. Biopsy taken in 2004 confirmed grade 2 left breast ER+PR+CERB [-].  Seven chemo treatments given, followed by six Taxol injections. Paclitaxel (Taxol) 260 mg injection, Put on Arimedex (Astra Zeneca) for six months, Continued with Xeloda thereafter for 2.5 months, Ultrasound of abdomen indicated growth in lesion,  Chemo started with Taxol 260 mg and Carbo 300 mg three weeks cycle,    After four cycles of above chemo, Femara tablets were recommended for 3 months Ultrasound indicated further growth in both lobes of liver, Started chemo again with injection Gem (1400  mg) and carbo (450 mg), Three cycles recommended before ultrasound examination. Radiation was carried out on left breast to treat lesions in 14 sittings in February 2007 and was completely cured.Multiple lesions in both lobes of liver, larger size being 5.8 x 4.2 cm more on RH,  Mild ascitis observed for 1st time as compared to earlier reports, For last four months, since December 2007, Faslodex injection being taken once a month.  Left shoulder was treated for radiation as muscles had traces of lesion in February 2008 through 16 sittings. Currently taking Lasilactone 50 mg since 12/03/2008.     Tapping of abdomen was done on 12/03/08 and 600 cc was tapped out. Tapping of abodemen was done on 25/03/08 and 2.4 litres was tapped out.
Posts.Title: Info and help Required..
